longDescription: Ginseng (‰∫∫ÂèÉ, r√©nshƒìn, literally 'man-root') is a sacred medicinal herb central to Chinese medicine and Daoist alchemy. The root, which often resembles a human figure, is believed to contain concentrated life energy (qi) and possess extraordinary healing and rejuvenating properties. Wild ginseng, especially specimens aged hundreds of years, is considered supremely valuable and is believed to grant longevity, vitality, and spiritual power. In mythology, ginseng spirits can take human form and possess consciousness.

mythologyContexts.symbolism: Ginseng embodies the union of heaven and earth energies, extracting essence from soil (yin) and air (yang) over decades or centuries. Its human-like form represents the microcosm-macrocosm principle - as above, so below. The longer it grows, the more it accumulates the subtle energies of the cosmos, making it a bridge between mortal and immortal realms.
mythologyContexts.culturalSignificance: Ginseng has been central to Chinese medicine for over 2,000 years. Wild mountain ginseng (particularly from Changbai Mountain) commands astronomical prices. The plant appears in countless folk tales of ginseng spirits, hunters' adventures, and cultivation stories. It remains a symbol of health, vitality, and natural wisdom.
